text.section: A person is guilty of criminal solicitation when, with the intent of promoting or facilitating the commission of a crime, he commands or encourages another person to engage in specific conduct which would constitute that crime or an attempt to commit that crime or which would establish the other's complicity in its commission or attempted commission.

law.history: Amended 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 477, sec. 3, effective July 15, 1994. -- Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 51, effective January 1, 1975.
